mdRecord.dcterms:title: A New Map of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: London; Showing the area from Pennsylvania to North Carolina, this small map also shows roads, towns, waterways, some residents, and relief. It includes "the 2 farthest Settlements in Virginia in 1755." The map was published in London Magazine, vol. 30, November 1761, opposite page 572. --From This New Founde Lande: The Henry & Kaye Spalding Map Collection at Hampden-Sydney College, 2008.
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Kitchin, Thomas, 1718-1784
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Maps
Chesapeake Bay Region (Md. and Va.)
Maps--Early works to 1800
Cartographic materials
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Henry and Kaye Spalding Map Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:provenance: The Henry and Kaye Spalding Map Collection at Hampden-Sydney College; Image appears on pg. 41 (plate 35) of This New Founde Land, Hampden-Sydney College, Virginia, 2008
